{"step_by_step_thinking": "MVA85A is a vaccine candidate designed to boost immunity against tuberculosis, not smallpox. It is derived from the Modified Vaccinia Ankara (MVA) virus, which is a highly attenuated strain of the vaccinia virus used in the smallpox vaccine. However, MVA85A specifically expresses the antigen 85A from Mycobacterium tuberculosis, not antigens from the smallpox virus. Therefore, it is not designed to confer immunity against smallpox.", "answer_choice": "B"}
